solution_line_template: On the first day, Cleo and Ignacio took {fraction_taken_day2} * {initial_marbles} marbles = <<{fraction_taken_day2}*{initial_marbles}={marbles_taken_day2}>>{marbles_taken_day2} marbles from the jar

When they shared the marbles, each got {marbles_taken_day2} marbles / {num_people_sharing} people = <<{marbles_taken_day2}/{num_people_sharing}={marbles_per_person_day2}>>{marbles_per_person_day2} marbles/person

The total number of marbles remaining in the jar is {initial_marbles} marbles - {marbles_taken_day2} marbles = <<{initial_marbles}-{marbles_taken_day2}={marbles_remaining_jar_day3_start}>>{marbles_remaining_jar_day3_start} marbles

On the third day, Cleo took {fraction_cleo_took_day3} * {marbles_remaining_jar_day3_start} marbles = <<{fraction_cleo_took_day3}*{marbles_remaining_jar_day3_start}={marbles_cleo_took_day3}>>{marbles_cleo_took_day3} marbles from the jar.

The total number of marbles she has on the third day is {marbles_cleo_took_day3} marbles + {marbles_per_person_day2} marbles = <<{marbles_cleo_took_day3}+{marbles_per_person_day2}={total_marbles_cleo_day3}>>{total_marbles_cleo_day3} marbles.
